EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) configured with burner‑inserters and output chests.
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) with a similar configuration.
Use-case: Smelts raw materials for production.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• Burner‑mining drill connected to a wooden chest and interlinked by transport belts for continuous iron ore extraction.
Use-case: Dedicated mining and transport of iron ore.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• Laboratory set up to receive automation‑science‑pack inputs, supported by a network of small electric poles.
Use-case: Advances research in automation.

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) featuring connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5).
• Offshore Pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5).
• Pre‑existing Steam Engines at Positions:
  – (1.5, 13.5)
  – (13.5, 14.5)
  – (19.5, 14.5)
  – (13.5, 17.5)
  – (17.5, 20.5)
  – (11.5, 20.5)
  – (22.5, 18.5)
  – (4.5, 23.5)
• Extra Steam Engine for Improved Integration:
  – Initially placed via an automated fallback at Position(x=12.5, y=21.5).
  – Repeated automated placement attempts have failed because heavy congestion and multiple obstructions prevent finding a buildable candidate near the desired area (approximately Position(8.5, 22.5)).
  – Placement remains unresolved; manual intervention is now required.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Failures
 – Automated routines for positioning the extra steam engine have repeatedly failed due to heavy congestion and overlapping or misaligned entities in the area around the boiler at Position(8.0, 20.5).
 – The intended candidate location near Position(8.5, 22.5) is blocked by interfering components such as misaligned inserters and overlapping transport belts.
 – Mitigation Strategies:
  • Manually inspect the area around the boiler and its connection region.
  • Identify and remove or reposition obstructing entities.
  • Consider relocating the extra steam engine further from the congested zone or adjusting the boiler layout to create sufficient clear space for reliable pipe connections.
